definition: stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
to capture
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: You thought your victory was inevitable, but you were wrong.
sentences.chinese: 你以为你的胜利手到擒来，但是你错了。

sentences.english: The beautiful wife is as inevitable as the mistresses.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，娶得美妻就像搞情人一样手到擒来。

sentences.english: Languages come easily to some people.
sentences.chinese: 语言学习对有些人来说手到擒来。

sentences.english: Sir Alex knows victory over Fulham is far from a formality.
sentences.chinese: 弗爵爷知道对富勒姆的胜利，并非手到擒来。

sentences.english: Ms Suu Kyi says that she herself will contest one of the seats up for grabs.
sentences.chinese: 素姬女士说她将争取一个手到擒来的议会席位。

definition: easy as a hand's turn (idiom); very easy/no effort at all
a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
to be nothing difficult/to be a cinch
as easy as blowing off dust/effortless/with ease
pinyin: bu4 fei4 chui1 hui1 zhi1 li4

definition: easy/with no difficulty
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
see 易如反掌[yi4 ru2 fan3 zhang3]
to be successful in every endeavor
not to pose a problem for sb/cannot stump sb
to be assured of success
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
as easy as reaching for it from a bag (idiom)/in the bag/(as good as) in one's possession
see 小試牛刀|小试牛刀[xiao3 shi4 niu2 dao1]
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
